entry.title: /third_party/boringssl: Ensure all paths are relative
entry.content:
Absolute paths make sandboxing, remote execution and caching

impossible, because they cannot be reproduced on other systems

and also vary by user and location of the current Chromium

checkout. It's best to use relative paths only.



With these fixes, the generated Ninja files no longer contain any

absolute paths that refer to my home directory, at least on Linux.



I verified that the build still works by building `all` target.



CQ run also passed for the pre-split CL: crrev.com/c/4682679



This CL was uploaded by git cl split.



R=davidben@chromium.org



Bug: b/291175318

entry.title: [FPS] Remove usage of SameParty attribute from network restart tests
entry.content:
This changes the focus of this test slightly since it no longer relies

on any information provided by First-Party Sets, but the usage of

kWaitForFirstPartySetsInit forces the network service to delay all

outgoing cookie-carrying requests until FPS has been initialized. So,

the test still does ensure that the Network Service does properly

reinitialize its notion of FPS after a restart.

entry.title: [mullet m2] Add UI only for address and name group filling suggestions.
entry.content:
We have 3 group filling suggestion types:



1. Address: When selected will fill all address related fields.

2. Name: When selected will fill all name related fields.

3. Phone number: Same as above but for phone number.



1# and 2# are conditionally displayed as their own suggestion in the new popup.



1# is displayed if the field is an address field while 2# if it is a name field.



3# is not handled yet because it behaves differently from other group suggestions as it does not have its own "Fill full phone" entry.



demo-ish: https://screencast.googleplex.com/cast/NTMyNzk3NjU4NjU0MzEwNHw1MjliYTMxNi05NA



UX fill full name: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/3sto2b5XbuW6WKX

UX fill full address: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/yY3kmPb2McRR643

entry.title: [Color correction] Enable color correction feature in M117
entry.content:
Enables access to a color correction feature on M117+

on logged in profiles. See launch/4239466.



Allows users to apply color filters to their Chromebook's

display to adjust how colors display on the screen. Filters

include those for common color-blindness, a grayscale option,

and custom settings.

entry.title: Add some non-const getters to SVGTextPositioningElement to match IDL semantics.
entry.content:
This duplicates some getters on SVGTextPositioningElement to have

non-const semantics, to match the semantics of WebIDL, where the return

value is not const. It retains the const versions because they are used

by C++ callers.



I believe this sort of code *should* be a compilation error, and I have

work in progress on a CL to the bindings code to make it one. This is

one of two const-related changes in blink that needs to be made for that

CL. (There are other type-related changes.)



Bug: 1464089

Change-Id: I2b2af70105f174cb741350e778de30c4b5215f9f

entry.title: [First-Party Sets] Remove WebSocket support
entry.content:
First-Party Sets used to support a SameParty cookie attribute, and

supported a "normalization" step which transformed WSS URLs to HTTPS

URLs for the sake of determining membership in a First-Party Set.

Since SameParty is now unsupported, we can now remove the WSS

integration from First-Party Sets.

entry.title: Clean up replaced sizing special cases for (outermost) <svg> roots
entry.content:
NGBlockNode::GetReplacedSizeOverrideIfAny() is only called by

ComputeReplacedSizeInternal(), and in the case the node is an

LayoutSVGRoot it will only be called after the same checks

(GetContainerSize() or IsEmbeddedThroughFrameContainingSVGDocument())

has been performed already. Remove it.



Reorganize ComputeReplacedSize() to more explicitly check if the

root is the document element, since all the special-cases only apply for

that. Remove redundant IsDocumentElement() checks and turn the check in

LogicalSizeScaleFactorForPercentageLengths() into a CHECK().



Bug: 1458399

entry.title: [UPMLocalPwd] Show the deletion dialog for exported passwords
entry.content:
The deletion dialog shows after the passwords have been exported.

It uses the PasswordStoreBridge to clear all passwords. That bridge was

first introduced for testing, but it was decided to use it here to avoid

adding cpp code to PasswordUIView and adding an interface to pass the

PasswordUIView all the way to the fragment who would invoke password

deletion.

CallbackDelayer, DialogManager, SingleThreadBarrierClosure and

TimedCallbackDelayer have been moved out of chrome_java.

entry.title: Add Kerberos ErrorType to the ShouldRetry() list
entry.content:
Add ERROR_UNKNOWN_KRB5_ERROR error type to the list of errors that

should trigger a retry of the AcquireKerberosTgt() method. The retry

logic is only applied to tickets added automatically, using the

KerberosAccounts policy.



This change will cause Chromebooks to retry when some unknown temporary

issue is preventing the device from adding a ticket. One example is the

"Resource temporarily unavailable (11)" from b/289742596, which is

related to some system resource like thread, memory address or network

socket.



The number of retries should not increase significantly with this

change, since it's still limited to 10 retries per policy update.

Additionally, UMA metrics show that this error corresponds to roughly 1%

of the results from AcquireKerberosTgt().



Bug: b:289742596

Change-Id: I42babd142f218e6127007d40583f0582216b48a0

Reviewed-by: Roman Sorokin

entry.title: [relaunch_notification] Fix interactive UI test on macOS and Linux
entry.content:
This test was failing on macOS devices that did not have Keystone

present because UpgradeDetector was not monitoring for updates. Now,

UpgradeDetector observes the BuildState on macOS regardless of

Keystone's presence. `GetInstalledVersion` will return the current

version if the Chromium updater is not being used and Keystone is not

present. This unblocks tests dependent on update notifications (e.g.,

RelaunchNotificationControllerUiTest).



This also makes update notifications work when the Chromium updater is

used and Keystone is not present on the system.



This test was also failing on Linux due to a race with the window

manager. To mitigate this, pump UI events after minimizing the browser

window -- simply waiting for the BrowserView's widget to become

deactivated is insuffient.



While we're at it:

- Disable notifications before teardown so that a restart isn't

triggered at the end of an otherwise passing test.

- Make the timing of the test a little more deterministic.

- Make a few members of RelaunchNotificationControllerUiTest static

because we can.

- Add a few more ASSERTs to the test to help diagnose failures more

easily.



Fixed: 1462892

Change-Id: Ia577e0f1b12340712a8b54109b3420c86a29684b

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4677678

entry.title: /build/toolchain/apple: Ensure all paths are relative
entry.content:
Absolute paths make sandboxing, remote execution and caching

impossible, because they cannot be reproduced on other systems

and also vary by user and location of the current Chromium

checkout. It's best to use relative paths only.



With these fixes, the generated Ninja files no longer contain any

absolute paths that refer to my home directory, at least on Linux.



I verified that the build still works by building `all` target.



CQ run also passed for the pre-split CL: crrev.com/c/4682679



This CL was uploaded by git cl split.



R=sdefresne@chromium.org

entry.title: Browsing Data Model: Tweak Media License & test more quota types
entry.content:
CL enables testing for fetching & deleting of more quota types,

including WebSQL, ServiceWorkers, and Media Licenses.



To enable Media License, some additional helpers are required in

the test, similar to the existing BrowsingDataRemover test.



As Media Licenses report as 0 size to the Quota Manager, they were

previously ignored by the QuotaHelper, which skips size 0 entries.



This CL thus also adjusts the QuotaHelper to retain 0 size entries,

which requires updating some tests based on the state of the SP flag,

as quota nodes may or may not be included in the CookiesTreeModel.



CL also removes some weird test logic that was comparing a static 0

to another static 0 in many places.



Bug: 1271155

Change-Id: I6075576268cb15d22e4f6e0706ff1fdfa5862bcf

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4675862

entry.title: [reland^2] [rust] chrome://crash/rust on ChromeOS
entry.content:
This enables the first bytes of Rust in the Chromium binary itself

for ChromeOS. It simply enables a chrome://crash/rust URI handler

which users should not normally encounter.



We're enabling this carefully and progressively across platforms.



This is a reland of

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4654230

which was reverted because ChromeOS' distributed LTO did not support

non-thin archives such as Rust rlibs.



That's been fixed in

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4665860

entry.title: Revert "[Local Network Access] Rename private to local in devtools observers"
entry.content:
This reverts commit dedc929d950335cb90fe5744700e9a240d2178f4.



Reason for revert: The spec has been renamed back to Private Network Access https://github.com/WICG/private-network-access/pull/106



Original change's description:

> [Local Network Access] Rename private to local in devtools observers

>

> In https://github.com/WICG/local-network-access/issues/91, we decided to

> rename Private Network Access to Local Network Access. The spec has

> already been renamed in

> https://github.com/WICG/local-network-access/pull/97. The latest spec:

> https://wicg.github.io/local-network-access/

>

> This CL renames PrivateNetwork to LocalNetwork in various devtools

> observers, and the places that use them.

>

> There are so many places to rename, so during the process, there will

> inevitably be inconsistencies. Hopefully, we shall resolve all of them

> soon.

>

> Bug: 1418287

entry.title: Redirect Imprivata logs to messages
entry.content:
Use the SYSLOG macro to redirect Imprivata debug logs to

/var/log/messages. This only happens if the debugLoggingEnabled

extension policy is enabled. Admins have this policy enabled in the

initial stages of setting up Imprivata, and adding the debug logs to

the messages file will improve the debugging experience of CEs, support

and admins.

Once Imprivata is set up and deployed to production,

debugLoggingEnabled can be disabled and logs will not be added to the

system logs any more.



Privacy approval: b/279975328



This CL also increases the log level of non-Imprivata extensions from

DEBUG to EVENT.



Bug: b/291047138, b/289234479

Change-Id: I319df4a45ba32a26d3fc16526a167a3cd81adb8b

entry.title: Fix flaky BidirectionalStream#testReadAndWrite
entry.content:
The source of the flakiness was a race condition between the networking thread finishing `onWriteCompleted` and the test thread reaching `setAutoAdvance(true)`.



This was the racy scenario:



1. Stream has started.

2. Test thread waits for `callback.waitForNextWriteStep();`

3. Networking thread calls `onStreamReady()` and unblocks the test thread.

4. Test thread waits for `callback.waitForNextReadStep();`.

5. Networking thread calls `onResponseHeadersReceived` which calls `startNextWrite()`.

6. `startNextWrite()` executes a write before `onResponseHeadersReceived` has finished.

7. `onResponseHeadersReceived` finishes and unblock the testing thread.

8. Testing thread calls `callback.setAutoAdvance(true), callback.startNextRead(stream), callback.blockForDone()` and blocks.

9. Testing thread hangs forever because there is another write waiting in-queue that must be triggered by `startNextWrite`.



This was the passing scenario:



1. Stream has started.

2. Test thread waits for `callback.waitForNextWriteStep();`

3. Networking thread calls `onStreamReady()` and unblocks the test thread.

4. Test thread waits for `callback.waitForNextReadStep();`.

5. Networking thread calls `onResponseHeadersReceived` which calls `startNextWrite()`.

6. `onResponseHeadersReceived()` executes a write before `startNextWrite` has finished.

7. `onResponseHeadersReceived` finishes and unblock the testing thread.

8. Testing thread calls `callback.setAutoAdvance(true), callback.startNextRead(stream), callback.blockForDone()` and blocks.

9. Networking thread executes `onWriteCompleted` and finds that autoAdvance is true which go ahead and execute the rest of write/read automatically and unblock the testing thread.



Current change scenario:



1. Stream has started.

2. Test thread waits for `callback.waitForNextWriteStep();`

3. Networking thread calls `onStreamReady()` and unblocks the test thread.

4. Test thread waits for `callback.waitForNextReadStep();`.

5. Networking thread calls `onResponseHeadersReceived` which calls `setAutoAdvance(true)` first then calls `startNextWrite()`.



This guarantee that whichever thread finish first, the write/read will be executed.



Change-Id: I6f384aaa872bad8111fb1c046323d1bd9c520b4c

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4678908

Commit-Queue: Stefano Duo

Auto-Submit: Mohannad Farrag

Reviewed-by: Stefano Duo

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1170416}

entry.title: /build/toolchain: Ensure all paths are relative
entry.content:
Absolute paths make sandboxing, remote execution and caching

impossible, because they cannot be reproduced on other systems

and also vary by user and location of the current Chromium

checkout. It's best to use relative paths only.



With these fixes, the generated Ninja files no longer contain any

absolute paths that refer to my home directory, at least on Linux.



I verified that the build still works by building `all` target.



CQ run also passed for the pre-split CL: crrev.com/c/4682679



This CL was uploaded by git cl split.



R=hans@chromium.org

entry.title: [Autofill] Fix limit in RationalizeCreditCardNumberOffsets()
entry.content:
Before this CL, Autofill wouldn't split a credit card number over

N x fields iff the sum of the maxlength is < 19.



This CL changes the `<` to `<=` because credit cards numbers can be

19 characters long.

entry.title: SmartCard: SCProviderPrivateAPI does not send disconnect twice
entry.content:
If SmartCardConnection::Disconnect() was previously successfully called,

do nothing once SmartCardProviderPrivateAPI is disconnected from that

SmartCardConnection's remote endpoint. Reasoning being that the PC/SC

handle represented by this SmartCardConnection is no longer valid.

There's nothing to cleanup at that point.



Bug: 1458363

entry.title: Fetch ScreenAI DLC download state on LaCrOS start up.
entry.content:
When ScreenAIInstallState starts in LaCrOS, it asks Ash for the download

status of the DLC and updates its state if DLC is available. This helps

in better messaging to user when user triggers the feature for the first

time after each restart.

entry.title: Update AndroidProtocolHandler to rely on chromium mime types
entry.content:
When a mime type isn't provided for file scheme URLs, WebView is supposed to infer the type from the file extension.



We use an API from the OS and so this might not be predictable.



Updating this to use Chromium's mime type checks if the OS didn't provide one.



Bug: 1019528

entry.title: [odfs] implement flush
entry.content:
Add a FileSystemProviderInterface::Flush call to flush the file on EOF

and call it from FileStreamWriter.



The default implementation is still a no-op for any file system that is

not ODFS. This does not change the behaviour of other implementations,

but the call is stubbed out at FileSystemProviderInterface level rather

than FileStreamWriter level.



For ODFS case, flush is implemented as an invocation of a custom action.



Bug: b/288013855

entry.title: ambient: Fix flakiness for the managed screensaver login screen test
entry.content:
The login screen tests for the managed screensaver were flaky. This

was due to the fact that unlike user policy, we were not waiting

for the device policy to be applied.



To fix this we now wait for the policy prefs to be updated whenever

we refresh the device policy. This guarantees that policy will be

applied before we actually run the test expectations.



Bug: crbug.com/1462870



Test: browser_tests --gtest_filter=*ManagedScreensaverBrowserTest*

Change-Id: Ib662f3fa806894f90ffc3b3871fab9b345a77235

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4675685

entry.title: [Files app] No type or size to XfIcon should render nothing
entry.content:
Currently if no "size" attribute is supplied to an XfIcon it will render

a black icon of 20x20 size. This does help avoid consumers accidentally

using no icon type, however, if no icon is the expected type then this

doesn't work. To avoid this introduce a BLANK type.

entry.content:

intended to be run when passed in through command line args or

--include. Unlike other variants, Wptrunner can not run the empty

name variant alone.

entry.title: Revert "iwa: Migrate Storage Partitions GC from Extensions to Web Apps system"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 3cba199e0ad9052733052a0cf884fc0ef9aae5b0.



Reason for revert: Seems to be causing CI failure https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/linux-chromeos-rel/67720/overview



Original change's description:

> iwa: Migrate Storage Partitions GC from Extensions to Web Apps system

>

> Both Chrome Apps and Isolated Web Apps use isolated Storage Partitions.

> This means any Storage Partition garbage collection system using

> BrowserContext::GarbageCollectStoragePartitions() must be aware of valid

> Storage Partition paths from both systems.

>

> Chrome Apps are being deprecated and IWAs need to work with web app

> command system to avoid race conditions. We are migrating Storage

> Partition garbage collection system from ExtensionsGarbageCollector to

> web_app::GarbageCollectStoragePartitionCommand. The new GC system will

> support Chrome Apps until they are fully removed.

>

> This CL does a few things to fully delete

> ExtensionGarbageCollector::GarbageCollectIsolatedStorageIfNeeded and

> replace it with GarbageCollectStoragePartitionCommand.

>

> For Extensions code:

> - Replace ExtensionsPref::kStorageGarbageCollect with

> pref::kShouldGarbageCollectStoragePartitions

> - Remove

> ExtensionGarbageCollector::GarbageCollectIsolatedStorageIfNeeded and

> its associated InstallGate.

>

> For Web Apps code:

> - Register pref::kShouldGarbageCollectStoragePartitions.

> - Sets prefs::kShouldGarbageCollectStoragePartitions to true in

> remove_web_app_job.cc

> - Register and unregister extensions::InstallGate in

> GarbageCollectStoragePartitionsCommand via ExtensionsManager.

> - Invokes GarbageCollectStoragePartitionCommand in PostProfileInit if

> pref is true.

> - Implicitly call GarbageCollectStoragePartitionCommand from restart

> using PRE test in

> garbage_collect_storage_partitions_command_browsertest.cc

>

> Low-Coverage-Reason:

>

> Change-Id: I5d418dc1b1f7bfc5890850d94d11a827b794b2ff

> Bug: 1453520

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4663920

> Reviewed-by: David Bertoni

> Reviewed-by: Robbie McElrath

> Commit-Queue: Zelin Liu

> Reviewed-by: Daniel Murphy

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1170246}



Bug: 1453520

entry.title: [execCommand] Support modifier+non-modifier in `KeyUp`/`keyDown`
entry.content:
This patch supports sending keys with modifiers in `keyUp` and

`keyDown` action sequences.



crrev.com/c/4654141 supported `keyUp` and `keyDown` for all

keys, but when they are combined, such as:

```

actions().keyDown(kAltKey)

.keyDown('c')

.keyUp('c')

.keyUp('kAltKey)

.send();

```

It's the keyboard driver's (`EventSender` in this case)

responsibility to keep track of the modifier key state, not

the `Widget`'s (which `EventSender` sends events to.)



This patch updates `EventSender` to keep track of the state.



This patch:

* Fixes 3 tests (6 sub tests.)

* Makes a WIP test in crrev.com/c/4679415 pass.

* Turns 1 timeout to a failure. The cause isn't clear but the

test fails at wpt too:

https://wpt.fyi/results/uievents/interface?label=master&label=experimental&aligned&q=keyboard-accesskey-click-event



Bug: 893480, 1462196

Change-Id: If1cf6e0a290c9f060135b2a67322aed3dd559e5a

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4680842

Reviewed-by: Mike West

Commit-Queue: Koji Ishii

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1170356}

entry.title: Disable flaky virtual fetch metadata web tests for Win builder
entry.content:
Also put relevant virtual tests into the same block.



According to test history, the test target

`fetch/metadata/generated/element-meta-refresh.https.optional.sub.html`

is both flaky in [non-virtual][1] and [virtual][2] versions on the

builder `WebKit Win10`.



Note that the [spec][3] also shows that the feature covered by this test, i.e. Fetch Metadata Request Headers, are not specific to JS `fetch()` API. So it also tells the flakiness should not be relevant in virtual tests.



[1]: https://ci.chromium.org/ui/test/chromium/ninja%3A%2F%2F%3Ablink_wpt_tests%2Fexternal%2Fwpt%2Ffetch%2Fmetadata%2Fgenerated%2Felement-meta-refresh.https.optional.sub.html?q=VHASH%3A3767ecdffabc49e7+

[2]: https://ci.chromium.org/ui/test/chromium%3Aci/ninja%3A%2F%2F%3Ablink_wpt_tests%2Fvirtual%2Fkeepalive-in-browser-migration%2Fexternal%2Fwpt%2Ffetch%2Fmetadata%2Fgenerated%2Felement-meta-refresh.https.optional.sub.html?q=VHASH%3A3767ecdffabc49e7

[3]: https://w3c.github.io/webappsec-fetch-metadata/



Bug: 1462796

entry.content:

do the calculate SubmissionReadiness.



This change is not user facing and the new args are not used yet.

entry.title: [BestEffortServiceWorker] Add redirect check metrics
entry.content:
This CL adds this metric:

ServiceWorker.FetchEvent.{Resource}.RaceNetworkRequest.Redirect



A simple boolean metric that records if the RaceNetworkRequest receive a

redirect response or not. Since RaceNetworkRequest stop the race when

the redirect happens and pass the remaining process to the fetch

handler, we'd like to know how this behavior impacts to the performance.



Bug: 1420517

entry.title: Remove Apps.Lockscreen.* histogram recording and mark obsolete.
entry.content:
Lock screen apps are essentially not currently supported, as they were

only supported originally for Chrome Apps (Chrome Apps are now

deprecated) and support for Web Apps was never launched. Usage is

extremely low as no current apps support the feature.



Not yet sure if the feature should be deleted entirely (and that will be

a big CL) so just delete the metrics, that have all expired or are close

to expiry.



OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAMS=Apps.Lockscreen.* removed as lock screen apps are not currently supported.



Bug: 1200355

entry.title: /third_party/libaom: Ensure all paths are relative
entry.content:
Absolute paths make sandboxing, remote execution and caching

impossible, because they cannot be reproduced on other systems

and also vary by user and location of the current Chromium

checkout. It's best to use relative paths only.



With these fixes, the generated Ninja files no longer contain any

absolute paths that refer to my home directory, at least on Linux.



I verified that the build still works by building `all` target.



CQ run also passed for the pre-split CL: crrev.com/c/4682679



This CL was uploaded by git cl split.



R=jzern@google.com

entry.title: Reland "Reland "Close the blank tab opened by clicking target=_blank links to home tab""
entry.content:
This reverts commit ad2f6dce3504fee5d64647b3e0f3d727305c0608.



Reason for revert: Disable the test on Mac as well. Like the previous

Windows failure, it was failing on a single Mac builder and can't be

repro'd locally or on CQ.



Original change's description:

> Revert "Reland "Close the blank tab opened by clicking target=_blank links to home tab""

>

> This reverts commit 1d43aebe6f6a83c6d9181c0ad1780a737292a0ab.

>

> Reason for revert: Suspicious about test failures of WebAppTabStripBrowserTest.NavigationThrottle

> https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Mac12%20Tests/10565/overview

>

> Original change's description:

> > Reland "Close the blank tab opened by clicking target=_blank links to home tab"

> >

> > This reverts commit 33c4f6d486508b80d817dc83fe4d09c081b4a7c6.

> >

> > Reason for revert: Disable failing test on Windows. The test was

> > failing on a single Windows builder and I can't reproduce locally or

> > on CQ. I'll try to enable the test in a more targetted follow up.

> >

> > Original change's description:

> > > Revert "Close the blank tab opened by clicking target=_blank links to home tab"

> > >

> > > This reverts commit 5f544b6e1fa028698d7cce8a94cf99858d445039.

> > >

> > > Reason for revert: Suspicious about test failures of WebAppTabStripBrowserTest.NavigationThrottle

> > > https://ci.chromium.org/p/chromium/builders/ci/Win10%20Tests%20x64/80872

> > >

> > > Original change's description:

> > > > Close the blank tab opened by clicking target=_blank links to home tab

> > > >

> > > > In tabbed apps with a pinned home tab, clicking a target=_blank link

> > > > to the home tab causes a blank tab to be opened in the app. This

> > > > happens because a new tab is opened because of the target=_blank but

> > > > then the URL is opened in the home tab, leaving the new tab there.

> > > >

> > > > This change closes the blank tab that was opened.

entry.title: Support registering dictionaries using no-cors mode same origin request
entry.content:
Currently we allow registering dictionaries only if the request was

fetched using `cors` enabled mode or `same-origin` mode. This CL changes

it to support registering dictionaries using `no-cors` mode requests

only when the response tainting mode is `basic`. The basic response

tainting mode of `no-cors` request means that the response was served

from the same origin server without cross origin redirect.



This CL also add CHECK() to ensure that `opaque` response tainting

requests should not trigger dictionary registration.



Bug: 1413922

Change-Id: I0b94f20768fba23c2e48ae279b3c0eb5d5023d3f
